intro: Galeopsis pernhofferi, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hedge-nettle, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as mint and basil. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, opposite leaves with toothed margins, and small, pale blue to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Galeopsis pernhofferi is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a characteristic species of certain Mediterranean and temperate ecosystems.
